snippet: Presented by 40 indignant English barons to their treacherous king in 1215, it has endured as perhaps the world’s first and best declaration of the rule of law. But some say that theory is a misreading of history.
abstract: Some legal scholars are questioning importance placed on Magna Carta, document written in 13th century England and revered as establishing principals that underlie democratic societies; critics say such interpretations misread history, even as elaborate celebrations are being planned for document's 800th birthday.
lead_paragraph: Presented by 40 indignant English barons to their treacherous king in 1215, it has endured as perhaps the world’s first and best declaration of the rule of law. But some say that theory is a misreading of history.

headline.main: Magna Carta, Still Posing a Challenge at 800
headline.print_headline: Magna Carta, Still Posing a Challenge at 800
